title: P-model reference run
code: # use a fixed model parameter set # assuming the same underlying mechanics # we'll not update these in new runs params_modl <- list(     kphio           = 0.09423773,     soilm_par_a     = 0.33349283,     soilm_par_b     = 1.45602286,          # Note, latter parameters were not calibrated     tau_acclim_tempstress = 10,      par_shape_tempstress  = 0.0    )  # run the model output <- rsofun::runread_pmodel_f(   drivers,   par = params_modl   )

title: P-model reference run
text: runs eval_sofun() routine included sofunCalVal package, outputs daily, monthly annual summary statistics comparing observed simulated values. ’ll retake routine running latest release (.e. workflow equivalent release rsofun package)

title: P-model reference run
text: Since rsofun takes time series forcing, overwrite forcing constant values corresponding arguments provided rpmodel::rpmodel().

title: Authors and Citation
text: Koen Hufkens. Author, maintainer. Stocker Benjamin. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Hufkens K (2022). sofunCalVal: Calibrate validate (r)SOFUN. R package version 1.0, https://github.com/computationales/sofunCalVal.
code: @Manual{,   title = {sofunCalVal: Calibrate and validate (r)SOFUN},   author = {Koen Hufkens},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 1.0},   url = {https://github.com/computationales/sofunCalVal}, }

title: Calibrate and validate (r)SOFUN
text: Provides basic benchmarking supporting visualization tools rsofun package. package meant internal lab use might serve others well (however limited support provided). Keep mind workflow dependent internal compute infrastructure limiting use benchmarks.

title: Calibrate and validate (r)SOFUN
text: package can used offline running (knitting) included vignettes. However, normal use online using github actions triggering build process included vignettes, visualizing benchmarking results.

title: Aligns data by events — align_events
text: Uses vectory specifying whether data falls event reshape data, aligning onset event

title: Aligns data by events — align_events
code: align_events(   df,   df_isevent,   dovars,   leng_threshold,   before,   after,   do_norm = FALSE,   nbins = 6,   normbin = 2 )

title: Aligns data by events — align_events
text: df data frame containing data continuously along time, required columns: "site", "date". df_isevent data frame nrow(df_isevent)==nrow(df) specifying whether respective dates (matching dates df), satisfy condition used define events. Events derived function consecutive dates condition satisfied (minimum length defining event given argument leng_threshold). Required columns df df_isevent: "site", "date" dovars vector character strings specifying columns (column name) df re-arrange. leng_threshold integer specifying minimum number consecutive dates required define event. events length lower leng_threshold dropped. integer specifying number days event onset retained re-arranged data integer specifying number days event onset retained re-arranged data do_norm logical specifying whether re-arranged data normalised median value bin (number bins given argument nbins) event onset, given argument normbin. Defaults FALSE. nbins integer, specifying number bins used determine median values event onset. used codedo_norm=TRUE. Defaults 6. normbin integer, specifying bin number just event onset, used normalisation. used codedo_norm=TRUE. Defaults 2.

title: Aligns data by events — align_events
text: named list data frames (list( "df_dday", "df_dday_aggbydday")) containing data events + dates (relative event onset) additional columns named "inst", defining event number (instance), "dday", defining date relative respective event onset. data frame "df_dday" contains rearranged, otherwise unchanged data (unless do_norm=TRUE). data frame "df_dday_aggbydday" containes data aggregated across events  mean quantiles given "dday".

title: Aligns data by events — align_events
code: df_alg <- align_events( df, truefalse, before=30, after=300 ) #> Error in df %>% left_join(df_isevent, by = c("site", "date")) %>% mutate(idx_df = 1:n()): could not find function "%>%"

what: Get observational data for model evaluation — collect_obs_eval
title: Get observational data for model evaluation — collect_obs_eval
text: Gets observational data model evaluation, given benchmarking variable, data source used evaluation. information specified evaluation settings (argument settings).

title: Get observational data for model evaluation — collect_obs_eval
code: collect_obs_eval(   siteinfo,   settings,   adf = NULL,   mdf = NULL,   ddf = NULL,   hrdf = NULL,   hhdf = NULL )

title: Get observational data for model evaluation — collect_obs_eval
text: siteinfo data frame containing site meta info (rows sites). Required columns : "sitename", "date_start", "date_end", "lon", "lat", "elv". settings list specifying evaluation settings (see vignette eval_sofun.pdf information examples) adf nested data frame rows sites time series (annual) site nested inside column data. mdf nested data frame rows sites time series (monthly) site nested inside column data. ddf nested data frame rows sites time series (daily) site nested inside column data. hrdf nested data frame rows sites time series (hourly) site nested inside column data. hhdf nested data frame rows sites time series (half-hourly) site nested inside column data.

title: Get observational data for model evaluation — collect_obs_eval
text: list containing nested data frames observed values aggregated several temporal scales (ddf daily, xdf X-daily (determined argument agg), mdf monthly, adf annual).

title: Get observational data for model evaluation — collect_obs_eval
code: if (FALSE) { obs <- collect_obs_eval(settings = NULL, adf = NULL, mdf = NULL, ddf = NULL, hrdf = NULL, hhdf = NULL, agg = 8) }

title: Evaluates SOFUN model outputs. — eval_sofun
text: Calculates set perfomance metrics model outputs, compared observational data. Currently evaluations GPP model outputs, compared agains FLUXNET 2015 data, implemented.

title: Evaluates SOFUN model outputs. — eval_sofun
code: eval_sofun(   mod,   settings,   obs_eval = NA,   overwrite = TRUE,   doplot = FALSE,   light = FALSE )

title: Evaluates SOFUN model outputs. — eval_sofun
text: mod Object returned runread_pmodel_f. nested dataframe sites along rows nested column "data" containing model outputs columns "date" (date object created lubridate::ymd()) "varnam". "varnam" corresponds names(settings$benchmark). settings list specifying evaluation settings (see vignette eval_sofun.pdf information examples) obs_eval (Optional) named list data frames containing observational data sites. names list elements corresponds site names. Defaults NA overwrite (Optional) logical specifying whether temporary data stored ./tmpdir overwritten. Defaults TRUE. doplot (Optional) logical specifying whether plots saved. Defaults FALSE. light (Optional) logical specifying whether reduced data saved. Defaults FALSE.

title: Evaluates SOFUN model outputs. — eval_sofun
text: list containing data frames modelled observed values  aggregated several temporal scales (ddf daily, xdf X-daily, mdf  monthly, adf annual), data frames respective performance metrics,  functions plotting respective data.

what: Format and run p-model drivers on Euler — format_drivers
title: Format and run p-model drivers on Euler — format_drivers
text: Takes site information single multiple sites grabs data required p-model run rsofun.

title: Format and run p-model drivers on Euler — format_drivers
code: format_drivers(   siteinfo,   params_siml = list(spinup = TRUE, spinupyears = 10, recycle = 1, soilmstress = FALSE,     tempstress = FALSE, calc_aet_fapar_vpd = FALSE, in_ppfd = TRUE, in_netrad = FALSE,     outdt = 1, ltre = FALSE, ltne = FALSE, ltrd = FALSE, ltnd = FALSE, lgr3 = TRUE, lgn3     = FALSE, lgr4 = FALSE),   params_modl = list(kphio = 0.09423773, soilm_par_a = 0.33349283, soilm_par_b =     1.45602286, tau_acclim_tempstress = 10, par_shape_tempstress = 0),   df_soiltexture = bind_rows(top = tibble(layer = "top", fsand = 0.4, fclay = 0.3, forg     = 0.1, fgravel = 0.1), bottom = tibble(layer = "bottom", fsand = 0.4, fclay = 0.3,     forg = 0.1, fgravel = 0.1)),   bias_correction = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   run_model = FALSE,   flux_data )

title: Format and run p-model drivers on Euler — format_drivers
text: siteinfo data frame using minimum information required five columns: sitename, lon, lat, start_year, end_year params_siml simulation parameters (preset) params_modl model parameters (preset) df_soiltexture soil data specifics (preset) bias_correction bolean TRUE/FALSE, using high resolution locations set bias correction TRUE, global runs leave FALSE (default) verbose provide verbose output (default = FALSE) run_model shoud model evaluation run, returns evaluated data instead driver files?

title: Format and run p-model drivers on Euler — format_drivers
text: returns rsofun compatible driver file provided  sites
